O Tiger
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Poetry: O Tiger
By Iron_Datu on Friday, July 1, 2005 - 11:01 pm:

O Tiger, Tiger blue and white
with eyes that sparkle clear and bright
stalking slowly fields of green-
peerless hunter brave and keen

Up ahead is our wicked foe
Dread diaboros bearer of woe.
Its skeletal stench wafts on the breeze
as we creep closer through the trees.

O Tiger, Tiger with fang and claw
you hurled yourself at the bladed maw,
yet away you came, unscathed,
with bravery that will never fade

In blazing arcs of shimmering lightning
You painted a dance of deadly smiting
Diaboros claws slashed naught but the air
its fearsome fire was but a signal flare

O Tiger, dear Tiger so brave and so true
yet your swift speed could not save you.
While Diabros fell to the earth with a crash
you staggered back bearing a bloody gash

O Tiger, my Tiger walk proud in the light
you freed our village from evil’s foul blight
